response_requirements.initial_response_description: 10 business days to disclose records that will be disclosed in entirety
response_requirements.final_response_notes: For partially public records: 10 business days to provide notice, then 5 additional business days to disclose public parts (total 15 business days)
response_requirements.extension_notes: 5 additional business days after initial 10-day notice for partially public records

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge reasonable fees for staff time for extensive searches and administrative costs

exemptions.description: Government records concerning individuals where disclosure would constitute clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy
Records that would frustrate legitimate government function
Records specifically made confidential by statute
Trade secrets and confidential commercial information
Attorney-client privileged communications and work product

appeal_process.first_level_notes: OIP provides administrative review and guidance on UIPA compliance
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Potential damages and attorney fees for wrongful denials

requester_requirements.identification_notes: Anonymous requests allowed; sufficient contact information needed for agency correspondence
requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No statement of purpose required; no restrictions on use of records
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written request required with reasonable description and preferred delivery method
requester_requirements.specific_format: Written request with contact information and record description

agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must provide in requested format when feasible (pickup, mail, email)
agency_obligations.mandatory_disclosure_categories: 16 mandatory disclosure categories including rules, opinions, contracts, environmental data

oversight_body.name: Office of Information Practices
oversight_body.role: Independent agency administering UIPA; provides guidance, reviews compliance, issues decisions
oversight_body.contact_info: No. 1 Capitol District Building, 250 South Hotel Street, Suite 107, Honolulu, HI 96813; Phone: (808) 586-1400; Email: oip@hawaii.gov

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields manually verified from official Hawaii statute. 10 business day response for fully public records; additional 5 days for partially public (15 total). Office of Information Practices provides independent oversight. Anonymous requests allowed. 16 mandatory disclosure categories. Strong presumption favoring disclosure. Court review with attorney fees available.
